title: LOL players are complete Aholes
body: Seriously people.  Its unbelievable how toxic and horrible you all are.  I haven't played a normal game in years where someone hasnt been a total jerk to their teammates or acted like a jerk when they killed someone and had to brag or say EZ.  Its like playing with a community of angry children that deserve to die slow and bloody.  Riot, you are completely useless in all facets of this game aside from collecting money.  Clean up your game and create harsher punishments.  You make enough money to regulate this shit and anyone saying otherwise is full of BS.  If you just halved the budget on retarded lore then you could pay 2000 people to actually investigate a report.  Your lazy and aren't to far behind in the bloody deservings of your players.  It blows my mind that you allow and are probably even proud of how your game has become the #1 worst community on the internet.

replies.body: You can thank eight years of Obama. Kids these days have zero values or morals. They just hate for the sake of hating.
http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/583/040/cff.png

> [{quoted}](name=Mogwai23,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3OvnV7qz,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-02-03T02:56:22.772+0000)
>
> Its like playing with **a community of angry children that deserve to die slow and bloody**.  **Riot, you are completely useless in all facets of this game aside from collecting money**.  Clean up your game and create harsher punishments.  You make enough money to regulate this shit and anyone saying otherwise is full of BS.  If you just halved the budget on retarded lore then you could pay 2000 people to actually investigate a report.  Your lazy and aren&#039;t to far behind in the bloody deservings of your players.  It blows my mind that you allow and are probably even proud of how your game has become the #1 worst community on the internet.

I'm pretty sure this also counts as being toxic.
This thread is a pretty good example of how League players are also the most oversensitive people in existence.

“The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.” ― Edmund Burke.  You mean capable book readers and not Aholes?    
Looks like we got a person who likes to make other feels bad. ^^^^^^^^
Your name is also interesting suspicious of over compensation of something.  Seems your ego is inflated a little.

You must not be a baseball fan. He's named after Ryan Howard's nickname "The Big Piece".

Also I agree with him, you're pretty oversensitive lol.
Wow. You are the first person ever to actually get that reference.
NGL, I only know that cause of the office lol.

Question; how is wishing a slow bloody death on children or on riot employees not "toxic and horrible"?
It's a pretty bad idea to directly insult the company you're trying to request change from. How you phrased this entire post just indicates that you're one of the toxic members of the community that you're complaining about.

I never said wish, I said deserved.  I'm also the 2 millionth person to point out this complaint so i'm hardly alone.  Also, believing bad people deserve bad things isn't wrong.  Don't you want ISIS to have something bad happen to them?  You can't say you never witnessed a person being a complete Ahole to others and didnt think they deserved similar treatment.  Lastly, I said riot is worthless so attacking them neither hurts nor helps my position.  If they were going to fix their community they would have done it after the millionth post concerning their unspeakable number of bad players.  Why, the last normal game I played no less than 3 players dropped the N word to other players.  Posting it for all to see and then calling out riot is a way of making change on a small level.  Revolutions start with sparks not bombs.  My guess since your speaking out against a post that wants the community to punish toxic players is that you are one.  If I were the kind of player that was constantly being horrible to people then asking for measures that would likely get me banned is kinda suicide.  So if you think about it logically your assumptions are ignorant.

I'm all for punishing toxic players. How you phrased your post is the problem. You can say that assholes need more strict punishment without saying they're children that deserve bloody deaths for saying words in a video game. That's just psychotic. 

>I played no less than 3 players dropped the N word to other players.

Did you report them after the game?

That's my point here buddy.  Reporting does nothing.  If it did the community wouldn't be this horrible.  Your half measures and weak answers are what enables these people to be the way they are.  I also view death differently than you.  While i wont impart it myself I don't believe all deserve life.  I'm never toxic to players and I'm unfailing nice in real life, but if being ok with all the Aholes in this world suddenly vanishing makes me bad..then I embrace it and will be bad to the bone.

>That's my point here buddy. Reporting does nothing.

I've seen the popup that my report got someone banned on multiple occasions.

> [{quoted}](name=Mogwai23,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3OvnV7qz,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-02-03T03:11:45.723+0000)
>
> "Don't you want ISIS to have something bad happen to them? "

No, I would prefer they are stopped and put to a proper justice system. Wishing anyone to die a horrible bloody death is as bad as killing them yourself, for all you know, your best friend could have had relation with ISIS, aaaaaaaaand you want him to go die in a horrible drawn out way? Yeah good one bud, think before you speak. Or, /mute all

besides, ISIS is an IDEA not a organization, "terror" is an IDEA not a Group, like I said, think before you speak, or in this case type.... that works to I suppose. Kind of off topic but imma just throw that out there

ISIS is in fact an organization.  It doesn't matter if they are spread out and not grouped up in a single building for you.  Ideas are abstract and intangible and incapable of killing anyone until a person or group of people carry it out.  Thats like saying guns kill people when its actually people who kill people with guns.  /mute all is a band aid and not a solution.  "Terror" is the emotion the "Group" tries to impart upon people through "ACTIONS" that were "IDEAS" made physical through blowing up buildings and the like.  I'm not sure how you think people work, but first they have an idea and THEN they carry it out.  If they stopped at idea then it would stop there.  Also what kind of nonsense is "Wishing anyone to die a horrible bloody death is as bad as killing them yourself"?  Thats not even remotely close to as bad as doing the deed yourself.  Its a thought not an action.  I'll bet plenty of people thought about snuffing you out and I'm damn well certain that if they had carried it out you would think the action was worse than the thought.
There see that wasn't so hard now was it. Do that more often, I am going to bed, I am clearly to tired to argue with you.
Well once you wake up you can explain your stroke right before bed cause your making no sense.  I completely disagreed with your nonsense statement and you retort with that.

K, regarding ISIS, their whole thing is being related to Terrorists, and terror is an IDEA not a organization that can be wiped out, now, back on topic, 

> No, I would prefer they are stopped and put to a proper justice system. Wishing anyone to die a horrible bloody death is as bad as killing them yourself, for all you know, your best friend could have had relation with ISIS, aaaaaaaaand you want him to go die in a horrible drawn out way? Yeah good one bud, think before you speak <

What about that eh? You really think that is a good idea? Saying you want someone to die OVER A GAME NONE THE LESS makes you a sadistic B*stard and worse then the worst kind of people in history

> "Wishing anyone to die a horrible bloody death is as bad as killing them yourself"? Thats not even remotely close to as bad as doing the deed yourself. Its a thought not an action.

You ever thought someone ought to go die, ever said that in game? Yeah good one bud, I believe it was SOMETHING LIKE.... K*y*s* f*g*t cmon, don't be like that, those are the scumbag players

Add me and we'll play tomorrow. You might be higher elo than me tbh. Higher elo has the meaniest people. Even if you report be sure to say what was said so they know what to look for in chat. Like if it was /all chat be sure to say that, same for calling anyone out of their name or inting check the time, keep a mental note and continue playing your best. 

Don't let others negativity make you jaded. Be the bigger person and tell them no that's not cool, don't do/say that. 

If we truly enjoy the game we'd help make it better. May your games never be so full of hate yo.

You've been playing this game for years, and only now does it become apparent that League has one of the worst virtual communities in existence? Most players figure this out their first couple months; first year tops. Riot even sends out an automated message warning you about it when you reach level 30.

That last part was sarcasm.
remember guys that kids play this game and probably 90% are kids. just watch lcs , they are kids playing.
Try smite. Come back to league and kiss the communities feet for being so much better.

Its a video game.  Competition is supposed to breed excellence not Aholes.  If you think its completely natural for people to act the way they do in this game then i can't imagine what you would find natural in a game like football.

Have you ever played football? DBs and WRs shit talk before the snap. DLs and OLs, same.

They try to get in their heads and break them down to gain a advantage.

Ok, I hate when people say this shit.

Duh some LoL players are Aholes. The playerbase is massive so ya theres more Aholes in LoL then say Runescape but trust me every game is fill with ~30% Aholes. You just see more when the playerbase is bigger.

I played Wow for years.   Which has the largest player base for like 8 years running now or some crap.  Never was it even remotely close to this game.  Also, there are 10 players in a round.  So if 30% of the players are toxic then you are pretty much guaranteed to have one in your match.  Since we are using math now.
I mean come on man...thats 1/3...freaking 1/3 of the player base.  How can you say that number and not be blown away?????

Because people are keyboard warriors.

I never played WoW, I wouldn't let myself cause I'd get addicted. So I really don't know if I'm even close to right with this next point.

Isn't WoW more on a PVM and story based game? It's alot harder to be a Ahole in games like that cause people generally attrached like minded people.

Pvp games though pit you verse who ever and it becomes a piss contest, people talk trash, people don't care about others, it's all about them. 

CoD, BF, RS PVP, D2 were all somewhat the same as League in this regard. In my 10 year CoD career I've run into a lot of dicks and cocky people, but I myself was no different, as I got older around Black Ops I started to not to talk in public lobbies inless someone called me out, I'd let my play do my talking for me and if that person stayed the entire match, I'd talk trash at the end. Most the time the person who called me out would be gone 5mins or 2 HQs in. I was a very good CoD player back then and being called out just made me better.

Also Taunting, laughing, flashing your lvl 7 mastery, or talking small trash isn't the sign of a ahole. It's something done in every sport to get in the other persons head.

I don't really care if people want to call this a sport but it isnt.  Even if it is, it isnt a aggressive sport like MMA or Football, nor is it a psychological game.  Its a video game where kids sit in a chair for 8 hours a day slowly developing heart conditions and flat butts.  Hardly an environment for people to be that aggressive.  Or to see it as natural for such aggression.  Last time I checked, video games were supposed to be the realm of people who were above pissing contests.  Also, I wouldnt call them keyboard warriors.  More like posers who only have the courage so long as they can't be reached.  Yes I'm sure that the next response will be "that's just how the internet is".  Well, its that way because of complacent do nothing views like that.  “The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.” ― Edmund Burke.  Sadly, 90% of humanity fails to understand this and has your view of the world.

I'd argue its a psychological game. If I get in the head of the other mid laner, he's bound to do worse, which is a advantage to me.

Is this the 1st true PvP game you've ever played? Also I'm sorry if everyone has my view, it's a realistic view, I can't change the world and neither can you. I hope you prove me wrong though, I'd love to say I talked to a guy who changed the world on a LoL forum.

No I played Darktide on a game called Asheron's call.  Which was for 17 years the most hardcore pvp game to be found.  Meaning the top level players could kill a level 1 and take all your stuff.  There were no safe zones, and doing something as simple as selling loot in town was a risky venture. There were spies for other guilds in yours and being able to trust was difficult.   Compared this game is fluff and not pvp.  This is more a strategy game anyway like Age of empires.

Asheron's call looks like Runescape, which also had no safe zones and crap during its early beta days. Also, D2 was around that time and although towns were safe zones, they were the only ones.

Also I would classify League as a stragey game, but not like AoE was lol. League is more fast pace and decisions a lot of the time have to be split second.

As far as 17 years of the only real Pvp game to be found, games such as Goldeneye 64 and Halo are both PVP, whether you consider F2p games as PVp is irreverent cause they are indeed PVP games lol.  Sooo sorry to burst that bubble.

I'll amend.  Cod and halo (despite, yes being classified as pvp games) are complete fluff compared.  In AC if you die you lose your items to another player and are given a stat penalty for dying.  In cod and halo if you die you just spawn somewhere and thats it.  There isn't even a comparison between the level of hardcore pvp here.  Thats like comparing concentration camps in WW2 to a minimum security prison with a day spa.  Soooo sorry if you thought halo and cod were "hardcore pvp".

> [{quoted}](name=Mogwai23,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3OvnV7qz,comment-id=000400000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T04:58:14.884+0000)
>
> I'll amend.  Cod and halo (despite, yes being classified as pvp games) are complete fluff compared.  In AC if you die you lose your items to another player and are given a stat penalty for dying.  In cod and halo if you die you just spawn somewhere and thats it.  There isn't even a comparison between the level of hardcore pvp here.  Thats like comparing concentration camps in WW2 to a minimum security prison with a day spa.  Soooo sorry if you thought halo and cod were "hardcore pvp".

PvP stands for Player Vs. Player first and foremost. If you prefer games like Asheron's Call then that's fine, but just because allot of the more modern games with PvP don't feature the kind of systems that that game has doesn't mean that PvP modes without them aren't "hardcore PvP" modes.

EDIT: Replaced "true pvp" with "hardcore pvp".

English my man..learn it.  I didn't say it wasn't as you say "true pvp".  I said it was more hardcore. Not "true pvp" is called PVE.  There ARE varying levels of PVP while still being as you say "true pvp".
My apologies then but I feel that my point still stands (just replace "true" with "hardcore"). If you prefer more hardcore versions of pvp that's fine, feel free to play them over others.

Im glad you got the feels even if they are black and white and somewhat 2 dimensional.  If your point is to say that all a game needs to be pvp is PLayers vs Players then monopoly, poker, hell even go fish is a pvp game.  Its obvious your definitions are limited and you need to expand your gaming experiences.  Also you failed to miss a key point that I'll point out to another 2 dimensional player above.

Shit Poker is by far the most hardcore PVP game out there.  You lose it all in that shit.

It seems like you just want to believe your AC is the most hardcore PVP game in the world, that's your opinion. Not ours, your talking about me being jealous but I think its you who is thinking black and white. Your fighting so hard to be right,

Lol, losing items/xp/whatever doesn't define PvP. Players vsing Players is what defines it. That is what CoD and Halo are. 

Samething in runescape, you lost all your shit for dying, and it came out around the same time. So your comment still is false.

I dont care enough to look up this Runescape game, and no where in any of my posts did I freaking say it DEFINED pvp.  I said it made the pvp environment harsher, a.k.a. HARDCORE PVP!  Never at anytime did I say it was the only pvp game in the world or that this or any other game was only a % of a pvp game do it lacking certain criteria.  Also, like above, saying that PLAYER VS PLAYER is all you need to define a genre, then Shoots and ladders, Mouse Trap, Sorry, and every other board game or game involving more than one player is a pvp game.  Like I told the dude above, your thought process is black and white.  The entire reason I even brought up Ashersons Call was because you asked if this was my first "true" pvp game.  So I answered your question and gave a description of the game.  I'm sorry that you got jealous I guess and can't handle that your games have been fluffy carebear games compared.

The whole "you can add 20,000 employees" thing is absolutely hilarious. Riot has less than 1/20 of that for its total headcount. You have no idea how game development and support actually works do you?

whats new?

shit demographic with the shittiest people on the planet

The problem with the community is not only the people themselves, but the defending playerbase using the same means of defending themselves.

Just because your top laner tells their jungler to gank better or calls you dumb, doesn't mean you reply with kill yourself. This is the mentality that makes trying to make league friendlier just a ring around the rosey. Case in point, your disrespect to riot just incourages disrespect from others here and to riot, not exactly helping the problem yourself. 

There's a mute button
There's a report button
Use them if somebody is a butt.

Don't be one in return. Just because somebody blows a cigar in your face doesn't mean you do the same. 

If you really want to make lol players look like saints, I've been told to put a plane in auto pilot and fly another one right into it just for locking in widowmaker on overwatch, through voice coms.

Mute fine, but id rather the problem be fixed than putting a semi band-aid on it.  Maybe if I could perma mute the enemy team.  For the third time now ill remind you all that reporting is useless and has never done anything.  Also, again...I view death differently.  It is a woven into part of life and not all deserve to be alive.  A persons actions determine that.  People can feel however they want, but I don't think they should have the right to act however they want.  If every Ahole in the world died right now cause i made a wish on a magic lamp the world wouldn't be worse off.  Unless it decimates 90% of the human population and society collapses.  However, if that were true and there were that many people who deserved death in this world then I'd say it was a good thing.   And Id hope that if someone maliciously blew cigar smoke in your face you wouldn't just turn the other cheek like some coward.   Your last paragraph makes no sense though.  If thats a reference to some overwatch thing I don't spend all day seraching the internet or really play that game.
